questions.question_text: What are two access management mechanisms in Cisco Webex Control Hub? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BE
B and E

Selected Answer: BE
B and E:

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit A company recently deployed Cisco Jabber. Users log in to Jabber by using their email address in a domain named company.com. The users report that they cannot register their Jabber telephony services when working from home unless they use a VPN. An engineer runs the DNS lookup tool in Cisco Expressway-C to troubleshoot the issue. What is the cause of the issue?

choices.D: There must be only one response for the company.com domain.
choices.B: There is a missing SRV record entry for the company.com domain.
choices.C: The company.com domain must be resolved only in Expressway-E.
choices.A: The TTL value for the company.com domain is too short.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
It seem a design where the Expressway E is not using a dual nic. So the expressway C can reach to the Expressway-E by hairpining. In these conditions, when you put in query type "all", you are specifying or expecting SRV and A records.Then, it should resolve as A records as SRV records _collab-edge._tls.company.com. But if this is not showings srv's, so it is probably they are missing in the public DNS servers, or may be the records are wrong in the DNS servers or anyway. I think answer is B by my experience.

questions.question_text: Which service must be enabled when LDAP on Cisco UCM is used?

discussion.content: Can anyone explain why it's D?

comments.content: When configuring LDAP integration on Cisco Unified Communications Manager (UCM), the service that must be enabled is the "Cisco DirSync" service. The Cisco DirSync service is responsible for synchronizing the user data from the LDAP directory to the UCM database, ensuring that the user information on UCM is up-to-date with the LDAP directory.

questions.question_text: What an advantage of using of the SIP OAuth mode in Cisco Jabber?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Secure signalling and media is not the benefit of SIP OAuth as it can be done without.
The benefit here is that the client does not need to update LSC and CAPF certificates each time they switch between on-prem and off-prem, instead they can use the SIP OAuth token.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/admin/12_5_1/featureConfig/cucm_b_feature-configuration-guide-1251/cucm_b_feature-configuration-guide-1251_chapter_0110100.html

Selected Answer: B
Key benefits of the SIP OAuth mode support for Cisco Jabber:

Enables always-on encryption without additional admin burden.
Secure signaling and media for Cisco Jabber without the need of Mixed mode (no CTL updates, certificates maintenance, and so on)
No need to install and maintain the LSC on Jabber clients.

questions.question_text: An engineer must enable onboarding of on-premises devices by using activation codes to a Cisco UCM server The engineer activated the Cisco Device Activation Service and set the default registration method to use the codes. Which action completes the configuration?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
D. is incorrect. You must first to provision and to add the phone to the database to get the activation code. Also it is impractical to add many devices manually.
Answer is C.

Reference:
System Configuration Guide for Cisco Unified Communications Manager, Release 12.5(1)
CHAPTER 40: Device Onboarding via Activation Codes
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/admin/12_5_1/systemConfig/cucm_b_system-configuration-guide-1251.pdf

comments.content: D. is incorrect. It says that manually provision new phones THAT HAVE an activation code requirement, rather you must to configure and provision manually the phone to get the activation code. First is to provision the phone and then get the activation code created when you save the phone to the database.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
C is not correct since another 2 more steps which are Create CSV File with New Phones & Insert Phones are required to "complete" the configuration while Add Phone with Activation Code Requirement is sufficient on its own.

Selected Answer: C
C seems correct according to this doc:

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/admin/12_5_1/systemConfig/cucm_b_system-configuration-guide-1251/cucm_b_system-configuration-guide-1251_chapter_01011100.html#task_1D98A6EBE82277D056446584CEF13597

comments.content:
C is correct:
Provision phones with activation code requirement. Following are two provisioning example options:
Add Phone with Activation Code Requirement
Add Phones with Activation Codes via Bulk Administration

choices.C: Create a Bulk Administration Tool provisioning template.
choices.A: Generate 16-digit codes by using the Bulk Administration Tool.
choices.D: Manually provision new phones that have an activation code requirement.
choices.B: Set the Enable Activation Code enterprise parameter to True.
